prerequisites: CV Builder app running on port 3000
Browser automation service running on port 3002

annotations.content: This test marks the transition from basic infrastructure testing (example.com) to real application testing. It verifies that the browser automation system can successfully interact with the CV Builder React application running on localhost, wait for dynamic content to load, and capture both full-page and component-specific screenshots.

Successfully demonstrates integration between three separate services: the CV Builder browser app (React/Vite on port 3000), the browser automation API service (Express on port 3002), and the Playwright-controlled Chromium browser in headless mode. This validates the complete development stack for automated testing.

The header component screenshot demonstrates the ability to target specific React components using CSS selectors. This capability is critical for regression testing individual UI components without needing to capture entire pages, reducing screenshot file sizes and focusing on specific areas of concern.

This test introduces waiting for the main content area to be visible before capturing screenshots. This demonstrates understanding of React's asynchronous rendering and the need for explicit wait conditions in automated testing of modern single-page applications.
